Sentencas: Apatite-type lanthanum silicates are promising electrolyte materials for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells (IT-SOFCs) because of the high oxide-ion conductivity and excellent transport properties.
Titulo: Fabrication of anode supported SOFC using plasma-sprayed films of the apatite-type lanthanum silicate as an electrolyte

Sentencas: High sintering temperature in making thin and dense lanthanum silicate ceramics, however, is the most serious obstacle to the practical use of this material to SOFC electrolytes.
Titulo: Fabrication of anode supported SOFC using plasma-sprayed films of the apatite-type lanthanum silicate as an electrolyte

Sentencas: In this study, we have succeeded in fabricating anode supported SOFC using plasma-sprayed Mg doped lanthanum silicate (MDLS) films as an electrolyte.
Titulo: Fabrication of anode supported SOFC using plasma-sprayed films of the apatite-type lanthanum silicate as an electrolyte

Sentencas: The films were deposited on the NiO-MDLS substrates by atmospheric DC plasma spraying, followed by post heat treatments in a reduced atmosphere.
Titulo: Fabrication of anode supported SOFC using plasma-sprayed films of the apatite-type lanthanum silicate as an electrolyte

Sentencas: During the heat treatments, the films were fully crystallized and the NiO-MDLS substrates reduced to the porous anodes of Ni-MDLS, which were confirmed by X-ray diffraction and scanning electron microscopy.
Titulo: Fabrication of anode supported SOFC using plasma-sprayed films of the apatite-type lanthanum silicate as an electrolyte

Sentencas: The maximum power densities of the cell using (La(0.6)Sr(0.4))(Co(0.2)Fe(0.8))O(3 - delta) cathode increased to 79.9, 45.4 and 21.6 mW cm(-2) at 800, 700 and 600 degrees C, respectively, compared to the Pt paste cathode, though the open circuit voltages of 0.90-0.97 V were similar for both cathodes.
Titulo: Fabrication of anode supported SOFC using plasma-sprayed films of the apatite-type lanthanum silicate as an electrolyte
Fabrication of anode supported SOFC using plasma-sprayed films of the apatite-type lanthanum silicate as an electrolyte
